bdglue2.encoder.avro

Class AvroSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdglue2.encoder.avro.AvroSchema

  • public class AvroSchema
extends Object
    This class keeps up with the avro-related meta data that we care about for processing.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Field Detail

      • SCHEMA_ID_UNSET

        public static final int SCHEMA_ID_UNSET
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • AvroSchema

        public AvroSchema(String name,
                  DownstreamTableMetaData meta,
                  boolean generateAvroSchema)
        Construct the internal representation of the Avro schema. It will generate the schema on the fly if asked, but will most typically get the Avro schema representation from an externa Avro schema file (tablename.avsc).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this table
        meta - the table meta data
        generateAvroSchema - true: generate Avro Schema and write to file. false: read Avro Schema from file.

    • Method Detail

      • generateFieldDoc

        public String generateFieldDoc(boolean keyCol,
                               String columnTypeString)
        Generate the String used to populate the "doc" property for a column.
        Parameters:
        keyCol - - indicates this is a key column
        columnTypeString - - a String representing the type (INT, LONG, STRING, etc.)
        Returns:
        a (potentially null) string for inclusion in the doc property of a field.

      • writeSchemaFile

        public boolean writeSchemaFile(org.apache.avro.Schema schemaIn,
                               String path,
                               boolean wrapAsEvent)
        Write the generated scheam to a file in JSON format.
        Parameters:
        schemaIn - the schema to format and write
        path - the relative path + actual file name
        wrapAsEvent - wrap schema as Avro Event prior to output
        Returns:
        success or failure

      • wrapAsEventRecord

        public org.apache.avro.Schema wrapAsEventRecord(org.apache.avro.Schema schemaIn)
        Wrap schema for a table as an Avro Event prior to output of JSON data.
        Parameters:
        schemaIn - schema to wrap as an Avro event
        Returns:
        wrapped schema

      • validateDirectory

        public boolean validateDirectory(String path)
        Make sure that the directory exists, and if not, create it.
        Parameters:
        path - the directory path we want to access
        Returns:
        true if the directory exists or we were able to create it; false otherwise.

      • getTableName

        public String getTableName()
        Get the name of this table.
        Returns:
        returns the name of this table. Note that this may be a variant of the actual table name in the relational schema.

      • readSchemaFile

        public org.apache.avro.Schema readSchemaFile(String fileName)
        Read the JSON formated schema from an avro schema file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file we want to read the schema from
        Returns:
        the instance of Schema generated from the file. null if not found, or the parse failed.

      • getSchemaFilePath

        public String getSchemaFilePath()
        Generate path + fileName for reading or writing an avro schema.
        Returns:
        the path to the file

      • getSchemaFileName

        public String getSchemaFileName()
        Get the name of the avro schema file we want to read or write. It is based table name with a *.avsc file suffix.
        Returns:
        schema file name

      • getAvroColumn

        public AvroColumn getAvroColumn(String columnName)
        Return the meta data we are tracking for this column.
        Parameters:
        columnName - - the key
        Returns:
        the AvroColumn object, null if not found

      • getAvroSchema

        public org.apache.avro.Schema getAvroSchema()
        Get the avro schema.
        Returns:
        the actual Avro schema that we are working with.

      • getSchemaId

        public int getSchemaId()
        Returns:
        the schema id from the schema registry.

      • setSchemaId

        public void setSchemaId(int val)
        Set the schema ID.
        Parameters:
        val - the value to set.
